channel.title: v1.9.0 on Longhorn Manual Test Cases
channel.description: Recent content in v1.9.0 on Longhorn Manual Test Cases

item.title: Test Support Bundle Extended Collection
item.description: Related issue https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/6754 Test /proc/mounts file Given Longhorn installed When generated support-bundle And proc_mounts file should exist in support-bundle/nodes//hostinfo/ Test multipath.config file Given Longhorn installed And /etc/multipath.config exists on cluster nodes When generated support-bundle And multipath.config should exist in support-bundle/nodes//hostinfo/

item.title: Test upgrade responder should collect system architecture and encrypted volume count
item.description: Related issue https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/7047 Test step Given Update upgrade-responder-url setting to http://longhorn-upgrade-responder.default.svc.cluster.local:8314/v1/checkupgrade > k -n longhorn-system get setting upgrade-responder-url NAME VALUE APPLIED AGE upgrade-responder-url http://longhorn-upgrade-responder.default.svc.cluster.local:8314/v1/checkupgrade true 22m Match the checkUpgradeURL with the application name: http://<APP_NAME>-upgrade-responder.default.svc.cluster.local:8314/v1/checkupgrade And Deploy upgrade responder stack. When Create unencrypted volume. And Create encrypted volume. And Wait 1~2 hours for collection data to send to the influxDB database. Then host_arch should exist in influxDB database. app_name="longhorn" influxdb_pod=$(kubectl get pod | grep influxdb | awk '{print $1}' | head -n 1) kubectl exec -it ${influxdb_pod} -- influx -execute 'SHOW TAG KEYS FROM upgrade_request' -database="${app_name}_upgrade_responder" Sample output:
